metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16860 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in samba's Heimdal KDC implementation, versions 4.8.x up to, excluding 4.8.12, 4.9.x up to, excluding 4.9.8 and 4.10.x up to, excluding 4.10.3, when used in AD DC mode. A man in the middle attacker could use this flaw to intercept the request to the KDC and replace the user name (principal) in the request with any desired user name (principal) that exists in the KDC effectively obtaining a ticket for that principal.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16860` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: heimdal: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.20').
